title: Urf not enough Urf
body:
Hello riot, I know We get it, urf is a thing you like to keep to your V.I.P club so they can have fun and enjoy the game, but hey URF has had some strong backing now over the rotating game que,


What do you actually lose by making URF a perm game mode, this creates a whole new opportunity for players to get more experience with champs without being raged at so much from ranked. Also practice skill shots, I think URF WOULD NOT HURT RIOT OR YOUR GAME LOYALTIES AT ALL.

Just like aram, Urf should have its place in LoL and not just a "novalty mode"

Lets all band together as a lol community and get URF a home in our universe.

We want URF.
We Want URF
Give us URF.

replies.body: People would get over it in a week and the queue would die, it works well as a sometimes game mode
I'd like to see NURF in the rotations, that would be interesting. Hyperactive kids would have to actually think before walking on the moon, if they wanted to win.
Urf weekly or monthly rotations would be best.

> What do you actually lose by making URF a perm game mode

Well, for starters, other queues would be negatively impacted by the existence of an "URF queue". Have you tried playing a normal/ranked/ARAM game while URF was in the rotating queue? I'd assume not, considering you seem to think there's no downside to a perma-URF queue. Other queues end up with 5-10+ minute queue times *at lower levels* of play while higher levels of play experience drastically sky-rocketed queues.

Then we come to the enjoyment of it (as has been pointed out already). URF is fun enough when it's a temporary queue. The first day or so is, by far, the most enjoyable as people are *generally* trying more varied champs/tactics but, as you would expect, it starts to become a queue of try-hards using what they consider to be the most overpowered champion(s) of the mode. With most-everyone doing that, it becomes the worst mode in the game.

> Urf should have its place in LoL and not just a "novalty mode"

Except URF *IS* a novelty mode. It was never intended as anything more, and was never intended to have a permanent place within the game. We're lucky that Riot actually listened to the community and implemented the rotating queue so that it *would* have a (semi-)permanent place within the game.

The rotating queue is enough to provide the fun of the featured game modes without taking away from what LoL is *really* about.

the 1st day of urf is always fun but by sunday evening its absolutely trash as the entire teamcomp is literally ALL broken unfun champs that are just WAY over powered. people figure out or remember whats broken op and it kills it for me.
why give urf special treatment? its not like its the best gamemode, OFA has that title.
